snippet: The cable giant will provide 6,800 hours of programming on 11 channels and 41 live streams — and, for some viewers, a way to find it all....
abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column describes how more than $12 billion spent by Comcast and NBC to secure broadcast rights for Olympics from 2014 through 2032 is now making sense in light of profits from ad sales and changing nature of how people watch television.
lead_paragraph: The cable giant will provide 6,800 hours of programming on 11 channels and 41 live streams — and, for some viewers, a way to find it all.

headline.print_headline: Betting Billions on Rio, Comcast Hopes to Win TV’s Future
headline.main: Betting Billions on Rio, Comcast Hopes to Win the Future of Television
